Sometimes I just sit and ask myself…

Why am I in a different city, 
Living in a rented flat, eating cold food, 
Working 9 to 10 just to earn money… 
When I’m not even feeling like myself?

Nobody talks about how lonely it gets.

How hard it is to make friends as an adult. 
How awkward it is to ask, ‘Hey, wanna hang out?’ 
How weird it feels to go to cafes alone, 
Or spend weekends watching series just to avoid overthinking.

We moved to new cities for ‘better opportunities,’ 
But no one told us that growth comes with silence, 
With homesickness, 
With crying quietly at night and still showing up for the 9 AM call.

Sometimes, I just want to go back -
To that version of me who laughed loudly with friends, 
Who didn’t check the time before calling someone, 
Who wasn’t ‘busy building a career’ but was simply… happy.

But if you’re reading this and feel the same, 
Just know: You’re not weak. You’re just human. 
You’re not alone. You’re just in a new chapter.

And it’s okay to pause, breathe, and admit… 
That adulting is hard.

But we’ll figure it out -
One lonely dinner, one new connection, one hopeful day at a time.

Rapido drivers never asked for much.
Just a way to earn an honest living.

Karnataka High Court asked Rapido and other bike taxi services to suspend operations until proper guidelines are made.
And honestly, it’s heartbreaking.

Because for us, it’s just news.
 For them, it’s their only source of income… gone overnight.

You must’ve met them -
 The college student riding in between classes to pay his rent.
 The single mom who juggles housework and rides to keep her kids in school.
 The man who left his village and came to the city hoping to earn, riding 12 hours a day just to survive.

Most of them don’t have savings.
They don't have backup plans.
They have families to feed, bills to pay, and now… no work.

No one’s saying rules shouldn’t exist.
But can we at least create guidelines without taking away someone’s rozi-roti?

These are not just riders.
They’re people trying to do the right thing - earn money without begging, stealing, or depending on anyone.

I hope the government moves fast.
Because for many, every day without work is a day without food.

Every morning, you look in the mirror.

You see the tired eyes.
 The unwashed hair.
 The bloated face.
 The stretch marks, the scars, the pimples.

And you whisper…
'I look terrible.'

But let me tell you something strange:
Your mirror doesn’t show the full you.

It doesn’t show the way you stayed up all night to help a friend.
 Or how your laugh makes the whole room feel lighter.
 It doesn’t show the strength it took to just show up today.

Your mirror can only reflect your skin.
 It doesn’t reflect your story.

And you are more than your bad hair day.
 You are more than your weight, your job title, your LinkedIn headline.

You are the sum of every storm you’ve survived.
 And every quiet sunrise you didn’t post about.

🌤 So next time you look in the mirror - smile.
 Not because you look perfect.
 But because you're still here.

This Generation Got Played - And No One Talks About It

There was a time when people told us:
✨ Study hard, get a degree, and you’ll have a stable job.
✨ Loyalty to a company will reward you.
✨ If you work hard, life will be easy.

They lied.

Houses? Too expensive. Even if you earn well, good luck affording one.

Salaries? Not keeping up with inflation. Meanwhile, CEOs get 2000% hikes.

Job security? You could be replaced by AI, automation, or the next ‘cost-cutting’ trend.

Work-life balance? A myth. We answer emails at midnight and feel guilty for taking a break.

Older generations tell us, ‘You guys don’t work as hard as we did.’

But they didn’t have:
🚩 Unpaid internships.
🚩 Endless job rejections even with experience.
🚩 14-step interview processes just to be ghosted.
🚩 Overqualification being a problem.
🚩 Side hustles just to afford basic expenses.

We were sold a dream that doesn’t exist anymore.

Yet, we’re told we’re ‘too sensitive.’ That we just need to ‘stop complaining and grind harder.’

But how do you grind when:
📌 Rent is half your paycheck?
📌 Therapy is a luxury?
📌 Every passion turns into a side hustle just to survive?

This generation isn’t ‘lazy.’
This generation is exhausted.

We adapt, we hustle, we fight for mental health, we question toxic work cultures, we learn new skills every year just to stay relevant.

And we still get blamed.

It’s not that we’re afraid of hard work.
It’s just that the world has changed - 
And no one prepared us for it.

Every time I try to cross a road nowadays, I get the same feeling -

How busy people are with their lives, how desperately they want to reach their destination, they'll not care if they'll hit/hurt you in between.

Everyone is overtaking, someone is coming from the wrong side, even when a car stops for me so that I can cross the road, usually there's an activa coming from the backside that'll go before me.

No one pauses. No one waits. No one cares.

It's sad man, really sad.

Everyone is so busy, no one cares about the other's safety!

And honestly, isn’t this the perfect metaphor for life too?

People are always in a rush - chasing deadlines, running behind promotions, hustling for success. And in that race, they barely notice who they push aside, who they inconvenience, or who gets left behind.

No one pauses. No one waits. No one cares.

Just like on the roads, in life too, we see rule-breakers getting ahead, those who follow the right path struggling, and the ones who stop to help others often being the last to move forward.

Maybe it's time we all slowed down a little.

No matter how fast we run, we’re all going to reach somewhere eventually. The real question is - will we reach with kindness or will we reach alone?

Because what’s the point of reaching your destination if you’ve hurt people along the way?

What will happen if people start adding their salaries in their work experience?

Few things I can think of -

More Rishtas coming your way if you earn nice :)

More Rishtedaar taane/jealousy 

Less pyaar more vyapaar

Friends calculating how many parties you owe them – 'Bhai, tera 30% hike ka matlab 3 extra Zomato orders per week hai.'

Cousins asking for ‘small loans’ – 'Bas ₹50k urgent chahiye, tu toh easily de sakta hai!'

Parents emotionally blackmailing – 'Itna kamata hai, par ghar pe toh ek AC bhi nahi lagwaya.'

Colleagues will finally know who is being underpaid (Office gossip level: Legendary)

Salary hiders will say ‘Salary doesn’t define me’ (Bro, we just asked, not proposing marriage)

Endless possibilities man!

This generation is not okay.

We are the most connected generation in history - yet we feel lonelier than ever.

We have:

Friends in every corner of the world but no one to call when we break down at 2 AM.

Thousands of likes on selfies but no one who genuinely likes us for who we are.

A ‘perfect’ life online but an empty, exhausted soul in reality.

Look around:

People are dating just to avoid being alone. Love is no longer about connection - it’s about convenience.

Looks matter more than loyalty. A six-pack gets more respect than a kind heart.

Luxury is being bought on EMI. We’d rather impress strangers than build real financial stability.

Success is about looking successful. People rent expensive cars for Instagram but can’t afford their rent.

Friendships are based on utility. 'What can you do for me?' matters more than genuine care.

Breakups are text messages. Ghosting is normal. Cheating is just a 'mistake.'

Marriage is seen as a burden. People want weddings, not lifelong commitments.

Jobs drain us. We work long hours, burn out, and call it 'hustle.'

Cheating is normal. People call it a 'mistake' while someone’s life falls apart.

Fake people win. The ones who manipulate, step over others, and lie get ahead.

Mental health is a trend. Everyone posts about it, but no one listens when someone truly struggles.

Success is about flexing, not achieving. Rent a luxury car, post a reel, fool the world.

Kindness is a performance. Show empathy online, be rude in real life.

Relationships are temporary. Love today, cheat tomorrow, move on the next day.

Loyalty is outdated. Who needs commitment when you have options?

If you're kind, pure, and loyal, this world will use you, break you, and leave you behind.

If you're too nice, people will take advantage of you.

If you're too honest, people will call you naïve.

If you're too loyal, people will treat you like an option.

If you're too genuine, people will think you're weak.

We chase things we don’t even want - just because the world tells us to.

We seek validation from people who wouldn’t even show up to our funeral.

We’re so scared of being left out that we forget what actually matters.

Maybe the problem isn’t society. Maybe it’s us.
Maybe we need to stop chasing, stop flexing, stop pretending.

Maybe the real flex is peace.

Maybe real success is having people who love you.

Maybe true happiness is living for yourself, not for likes.

P.s - The writer in me was dying to come out today and write!! So, sorry for the long post :)

If you're constantly seeing motivational posts like 'I wake up at 4 AM, meditate for an hour, run a marathon, and close five deals before breakfast,' I just want to remind you… it’s okay to sleep in till 10 AM and stare at the ceiling questioning life.

We all sometimes feel like we’re falling behind - people are getting dream jobs, buying houses, launching startups, and here we are… *celebrating the fact that we finally did our laundry.*

But you know what? *That’s okay.* 

Life is not a productivity contest. Some people sprint, some people jog, and some (like me) take snack breaks every five minutes. The goal is to *not burn out before reaching the finish line.* 

So if you need a break, take it. If you want to rest, do it guilt-free. *Your worth is not measured by how many ‘grindset’ reels you watch.* 

And remember, even your phone needs to recharge. So why shouldn’t you?

Why should a corporate majdoor go to the gym?

Channelise your anger, lift heavy and next time when a jerk comes and taunts you for your work, you'll feel the power - I deadlifted 145 today, I can deadlift 2 of him.

You'll not have to worry about your mental health anymore. Start running and you'll be confused - which is worse? my mental health or my physical health?

You'll stop overthinking. Because instead of lying awake at night questioning your life choices, you'll be passed out by 10 PM thinking — Was that my last set or did I black out?

And forget office politics — once you hit leg day properly, the only thing you'll be thinking is, 'How do I climb these 3 stairs without crying?'

The next time someone dumps extra work on you at 6 PM, you won't get angry - you'll smile and think, 'I'll use this frustration to hit a new PR tomorrow.'

Cardio will teach you life’s biggest lesson - no matter how fast you run, you can’t escape your problems… or your boss's 7 AM meeting invite.
